article_title: South Carolina rejected Medicaid expansion, but numbers will still go up
article_text: Like half the states, South Carolina chose not to expand Medicaid under the federal health law, citing the program’s high costs and inefficiency. Yet state officials still forecast a 16 percent enrollment jump by the end of June 2015, even higher than the average increase expected in states that are expanding eligibility. What’s going on?

article_metadata.news-keywords: South Carolina, Medicaid, Affordable Care Act
article_metadata.title: South Carolina rejected Medicaid expansion, but numbers will still go up | McClatchy DC
